description.narrative: 1.4. Education institutions in selected departments and municipalities provide quality early learning opportunities to children under five years in at least two of the four departments receiving UNICEF support, which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children between 0 and 5 have access to Integrated Early Childhood Development (IECD) services to guarantee that they survive and thrive, including in emergency situations.

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/401 OCM 1. EVERY CHILD SURVIVES AND THRIVES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.4. Education institutions in selected departments and municipalities provide quality early learning opportunities to children under five years in at least two of the four departments receiving UNICEF support

description.narrative: Child development and early childhood education services were strengthened in support to the IECD models in two municipalities (El Alto and Independencia) focusing on the training of staff using the following strategic tools: Healthy Living Habits (Sesame Street), Care for Child Development (CCD), Child Development Surveillance Standard Tool (Norma de Vigilancia del Desarollo Infantil Temprano), Bilingual nests, and the promotion of recreational strategies. All contributed to quality of care for 5,085 children under 5, from 78 Child Centers in the Municipalities of El Alto and Independencia and in 72 bilingual nests representing seven indigenous groups. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: % of IECD El Alto (Mercedes Area) e Independencia centers and early childhood level schools that apply quality standards that promote early learning in the municipalities supported by UNICEF

baseline.value: 0% en El Alto (La Paz Dpt.), 0% in Independencia (Cochabamba Dept.)

target.value: 2018:10% en El Alto (La paz Dept.) , 10% Independencia (Cochabamba Dept.)

title.narrative: Country Programme incorporates early stimulation, protection and nutrition packages targeting children aged 0-3 (Including Care for Child Development)

target.value: 2022:Score 4 (Established) in El Alto (Mercedes Area) and in Independencia
